synopsis.text:
Curiosity leads a young, red-haired girl named Mary Smith into an extraordinary adventure when she follows a peculiar, color-changing cat into the depths of a nearby forest. Living with her Great Aunt Charlotte, Mary's mundane life takes a thrilling turn upon discovering a rare, magical blue flower known as 'Fly-by-Night' and an old broomstick hidden in the woods.

After accidentally releasing the magic within the Fly-by-Night, the broomstick transports Mary to the enigmatic Endor College for Witches. Mistaken for a new student, Mary finds herself entangled in a world of magic and deception, where things are not as they seem. Led by the cunning headmistress Madam Mumblechook and the brilliant Doctor Dee, the college hides dark secrets involving terrifying experiments and transformations.

As Mary stumbles upon imprisoned, mutant animals and learns of the sinister intentions of the college's leaders, she realizes that she must act to set things right. With her newfound friends and the magical Fly-by-Night flower, Mary embarks on a daring journey to save the creatures and uncover the true nature of Endor College. In this captivating tale of courage, friendship, and self-discovery, Mary must navigate the challenges of the magical world and ultimately find her place within it.
